subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: An unorthodox variant {{Han simp|縕|f=𥁕|t=昷|nocap=y}} which can be found in various historical dictionaries such as the Ming dynasty <big>《重訂直音篇》</big>. <!-- http://dict.variants.moe.edu.tw/variants/rbt/word_attribute.rbt?quote_code=QjAzNDMxLTAwMQ#62 -->

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
This character is the traditional form of {{l|zh|缊}} based on the {{w|Xin Zixing}} ({{w2|zh|新字形}}) standardized form of characters used in mainland China.

It is also the preferred form used in modern Hong Kong, where traditional Chinese is still used. <!-- Refer HKSCS 2016 (Table 2) and http://input.foruto.com/ccc/gongbiu/dzijingbiu/ -->
